intro: Tephrosia hadramautica, commonly known as the Hadramaut tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Tephrosia hadramautica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
